aboutMe.name: Erik Cruz de Oliveira
aboutMe.title: Game Developer | C# | Unity | C++| Unreal | C# Unity Programmer at Edify Education
aboutMe.description: My name is Erik, and I’m a game programmer based in Porto Alegre, Brazil. I began my programming journey with C++, C#, and PHP, and have been deeply involved with Unity, studying it since 2015 and working professionally with the engine since 2016. Throughout my career, I’ve worked on multiplayer games (using Unity’s HLAPI, Mirror HLAPI, and Photon PUN), VR games for Oculus Go, and backend integration with JavaScript, TypeScript, Prisma, GraphQL, AWS Lambda, GameSparks, and Steamworks.NET. I was actively involved in features including UI/UX programming, gameplay development, and tools creation. Academically, I’ve had the chance to explore Unity, Physics, AR with Vuforia OpenGL Phaser with Ionic, Arduino, Unreal Engine 4 and 5, C and 3D math. Some of my recent projects include Relic Hunters: Legend (a multiplayer shooter-looter), Edify Play (a mobile/WebGL educational game), and Remnants of Nightfall (my final college project developed in Unreal Engine 5).

gallery.description: Edify Education is a company focused on creating a bilingual generation in Brazil. At Edify Education, I worked on the game/platform Edify Play, contributing to its release and maintaining new features.

projects.description:
Edify Play is a gamified platform focused on teaching English to children and teenagers. In this project, I worked on features such as:
  • Implemented character skins
  • Created new activity tracks
  • Developed and optimized UI/UX programming
  • Integrated with the backend using GraphQL to update player data and load activities from the activity editor
  • Developed new game modes
  • Performed general codebase maintenance including bug fixes and implementing new features
  • Worked on backend features using TypeScript, React, Node.js, Prisma, and GraphQL
  • Worked with native features for Android, WebGL, and iOS
  • Implemented and maintained Unity Cloud features, including build automation and Remote Config

gallery.description: Rogue Snail is a fully remote game studio from Brazil. We have fully embraced remote work. At Rogue Snail I worked on the game Relic Hunters: Legends for about four years.

projects.description:
Fast. Fluid. Fun. Free. An online cooperative Shooter/Looter/RPG. Gather up to 4 friends, gear up, and save the Galaxy from a terrible villain who has stolen the past!
In Relic Hunters: Legends, I developed features such as:
  • Developing narrative tools extending from Fungus Package to empower the narrative designer team with in-game cutscenes creation
  • Creating new enemies and improving the character skill system
  • Party system features using Steamworks.NET, including invites, retrieving Steam friends, displaying the friend list, and programming the Party System's UI/UX
  • New game modes and maintaining older game modes as a Gameplay Programmer
  • Addressing multiplayer synchronization issues using Photon PUN
  • Implementing backend features using JavaScript, AWS Lambda, Gamesparks, and DynamoDB for features such as collectible chests and game mode aspects involving backend
  • Dealing with IA and runtime navigation baking
  • Creating custom shader effects such as Silhouette effects
In this project I created new features and also was responsible for porting a mobile/cardboard VR game into Oculus Go Platform.
